intro: Polypleurum erectum, commonly known as the erect fern, is a species of fern native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright, slender fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant has a creeping rhizome that produces clusters of small, oval-shaped spore-bearing leaves. Its fronds are pinnately compound with serrated margins and a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
